d1: The title of the chart is 'WHAT MAKES YOU THINK THAT THERE IS MORE CRIME THAN TWO YEARS AGO?'.
d2: The x-axis depicts the different options while the y-axis shows the percentage of people who selected each option.

insight1.insightSentence: The most popular opinion among respondents was that TV (57%) followed closely by what is read in the newspaper (48%) were two primary influencers that made people think that crime has increased over the past two years.

subInsights.phrases: The most popular opinion among respondents was that TV (57%)

data: From what I read in Newspaper, 0.48
subInsights.phrases: what is read in the newspaper (48%)

insight2.insightSentence: A minority of respondents reported that Internet (3%), police presence (1%) and other (5%) factors were also potential contributors.

subInsights.phrases: A minority of respondents reported that Internet (3%), police presence (1%) and other (5%) factors were also potential contributors.

insight3.insightSentence: TV and news articles were perceived to be more influential than personal experience (20%) and radio (15%) of deciding whether crime rate is higher than two years ago.
